title: In the village of Paris, Russia, a resigned acceptance of war despite grief
summary: The village in the Urals and its 1,700 inhabitants have lost four of their own to the war in Ukraine, and 16 more are fighting. And yet, two years on, there is little opposition to the conflict – only resignation.

title: King Charles diagnosed with 'a form of cancer,' receiving treatment
summary: Following treatment for a benign prostate condition, 'a separate issue of concern was noted,' reported Buckingham Palace without specifying what type of cancer it was.

title: France's controversial approach to preventing infertility
summary: Medical professionals do not find the Elysée's proposal of fertility consultations at the age of 25, including spermograms or gynecological examinations, suitable. Instead, they emphasize the need for more information on the topic.

title: Senegalese lawmakers ratify delay of presidential election until December
summary: President Macky Sall on Saturday announced the postponement of the presidential election vote, originally scheduled for February 25.

title: China signals openness amid economic decline, yet fails to convince
summary: By bringing a large delegation to Davos and offering visa-free visits to certain countries, Beijing is seeking to attract foreign investors once again. However, after three years of isolation, it faces challenges in persuading them.

title: The Venerable H., monk of all uprisings in Myanmar
summary: He was one of the leaders of the 'Saffron Revolution' in 2007, before going into exile in Norway. This man of faith has returned to his country to support the rebellion against the military junta and raise funds on its behalf.

title: Chile's deadly fires are country's worst disaster in a decade
summary: At least 112 people have lost their lives in the forest fires ravaging the Valparaiso region in central Chile, with around 40 fires still active as of Sunday evening.

title: Two Indian restaurants and two French chefs: The winners of Michelin's 2024 Great Britain & Ireland guide
summary: Only one three-star; but six new two-star and 19 first-timers, including two French: The 50th edition of the Michelin Guide Great Britain and Ireland also featured cities other than London.

title: Azerbaijan's Aliyev poised for self-glorification in tailor-made election
summary: Buoyed by his military success in Nagorno-Karabakh, the incumbent is set to win a fifth term in the election he brought forward by a year, against a backdrop of increasing repression of civil liberties and the press.

title: Paris voters back proposal to triple parking fees for SUV drivers
summary: The French capital's mayor hailed a 'clear choice of Parisians' in favor of a measure that is 'good for our health and good for the planet.'

title: French foreign minister declares Israeli 'settler violence must stop'
summary: Visiting Israel and the West Bank on Monday, Stéphane Séjourné was making his first tour of the region since taking office in January.

title: Paris police investigate motive behind train station knife attack
summary: A 32-year-old Malian man suffering from a psychiatric disorder, armed with a knife and hammer, injured three people at Paris's Gare de Lyon on Saturday.

title: Chile's destructive wildfires, in photos
summary: Forest fires are ravaging the Valparaiso region, in the center of the country, causing the country's 'greatest tragedy' in more than a decade, according to President Gabriel Boric.

title: UNESCO World Heritage site is engulfed by flames in Patagonia, Argentina
summary: Since January 25, a fire has raged in part of Los Alerces National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage site. The authorities suspect arson.

title: UN chief appoints independent panel to assess UNRWA
summary: More than a dozen nations have cut off financing to the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in response to Israel's claims that 12 of its employees were complicit in the October 7 attack.

title: UK and Irish leaders visit Northern Ireland as power sharing resumes
summary: Rishi Sunak and Leo Varadkar both met with Northern Ireland's new political leaders on Monday to mark the return of government.

title: El Salvador's Bukele proclaims 'historic' victory in re-election defying constitution
summary: Exit polls gave 87% of the vote to the president, despite the fact that the country's constitution prohibits an incumbent from running. He announced that his party had also won 58 of 60 seats in parliament.

title: American universities are stuck between social justice and freedom of expression
summary: The influence of administrations at academic institutions is being challenged, as on-campus conversations around 'diversity, equity and inclusion' begin to meet resistance.

title: California storms leave at least three dead
summary: A potent storm unleashed record rainfall in Los Angeles on Monday, causing mudslides in upscale neighborhoods and prompting California Governor Gavin Newsom to declare a state of emergency.

title: One year after the Turkish earthquake, a small town fights through tears for justice
summary: The disaster killed more than 53,000 people on February 6, 2023, and the inhabitants of one town are determined to hold those who they say are responsible for these deaths to account.

title: Japan looks to protect children after an earthquake
summary: Confronted with recurring disasters, most recently on January 1, Japanese authorities and NGOs are trying to mitigate the effects of shock and post-traumatic stress on children.

title: Paris 2024: For France, a top-5 medal count is 'more than ever within reach'
summary: On Tuesday, January 23, Emmanuel Macron stated that 'France could have its best Olympics since 1900' in terms of sporting results. Failure to do so would signal the failure of France's high-performance sports policy.

title: 'Europe's economic stagnation is no longer a risk but a reality that needs to be urgently tackled'
summary: Since 2000, the eurozone's growth has lagged behind the US by 17%, highlighting its vulnerabilities in a challenging global environment. Stéphane Lauer argues that Europe must complete its integration to address these challenges.

title: Cunnilingus is the latest television star
summary: Long absent from screenplays, cunnilingus is increasingly being depicted on screen, particularly in television. Now it's almost become a rite of passage for productions that want to seem progressive.

title: Paris screening of 'The Zone of Interest' by anti-Zionist Jewish group sparks controversy
summary: The historian Johann Chapoutot was due to take part in the event, but criticized the Tsedek! group for using the phrase 'Palestinian resistance' in a statement on October 7, 2023.

title: Senegal's postponed election: How Macky Sall plunged the country into uncertainty
summary: In announcing the indefinite postponement of the February 25 presidential election, President Sall said he wanted a 'free, transparent and inclusive' election to be held. However, his decision is being contested.

title: EU's von der Leyen backtracks on cutting pesticide use
summary: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the proposal to halve chemical pesticide use in the EU by the end of the decade had 'become a symbol of polarization.'
